paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 variant K897T, including clinical significance, patient demographics, penetrance data, and functional studies.

patients.phenotype: Long QT syndrome with multiple ventricular extrasystoles and one syncope

individual_records.phenotype_details: exhibited multiple ventricular extrasystoles and one syncope
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband (MMRL0362), a 32-year-old female, exhibited multiple ventricular extrasystoles and one syncope.

functional_data.summary: K897T- Kv11.1 channels displayed a significantly reduced tail current density compared with WT-Kv11.1 at potentials >+10 mV.

variants.additional_notes: The K897T variant is described as a common polymorphism.
key_quotes: Interestingly, channel availability assessed using a triple-pulse protocol was slightly greater for K897T compared with WT.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for the KCNH2 variant K897T was successfully extracted.
